column4: Is there a good software app that can covert to ipod video format on ubuntu?
but you'll first have to install ffmpeg from the repo
I get the message 'unknown codec' in the terminal when I go to covert.  Any ideas?
can you say that again, what's the problem?
the files can't covert because it says 'unknown codec'
medibuntu, I'm looking at my update manager... doesn't seem listed
sorry for the noob question, but how would I do that?

ok, first go to synaptic package manager (system -> administration ) and search for winff. Right-click it an choose: completly remove. Do the same for "ffmpeg". Then install the medibuntu repo (the first point in this guide: http://linuxowns.wordpress.com/2008/06/23/install-audio-and-video-codecs-in-ubuntu/). Then install ffmpeg again, idem dito for winff
very good .  thank you very much!
should I also completely remove anything related or sharing the ffmpeg codec?
uh oh.  I get an error, "ffmpeg:   Depends: libc6 (>=2.7-1) but 2.6.1-1ubuntu10 is to be installed" when I try to re-install ffmpeg.
any ideas on why it broke?
after I installed the medibuntu repositories, I can't install ffmpeg
the link you gave me was for hardy, not gutsy
